oai_dc:dc.dc:title: USGS Real-Time Water Data for the Nation
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Chemistry
Environmental science
Hydrology
Watershed health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This USGS site allows students to access a variety of streamflow information. There is an interactive map where the user can select streamflow data for selected stream gaging stations in the United States. Stations can be selected in list form, an interactive state map, or 10 nearest stations to position selected. Each retrieval form allows the user to refine their data search through predefined displays, such as tables, maps, or reports. Tables can be called up and further defined by basin, county, or hydrologic unit. For those unfamiliar with the process of data collection, an explanation of stream gaging is provided by a link.
Educational level is: Graduate or professional
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Information presented on this website is considered public information and may be distributed or copied. Use of appropriate byline/photo/image credit is requested.
